file_content.text: Really can't thank you enough for everything you've done.
We heard the good news!
The governor wishes to....
The governor wishes to congratulate you herself. You've done some truly incredible work for Taris--every last person here is in your debt.
Knowing we've made Taris safer is reward enough for me.
No need to feel indebted.
You've done far more than that.
We all have a responsibility to help restore what the Sith have destroyed.
Happy to help.
Still, you've taken on a much greater responsibility than most people could.
Just doing our duty.
It was nothing.
You're much too modest. Very few people could have achieved all of this.
If anyone wants to show their gratitude, feel free to pass on my contact information.
I do accept gifts.
We'll be glad to.
Are there any other problems that need attention, Governor?
Can I do more to help?
I can't imagine asking any more of you.
You've done so much already--but there is always more.
This planet is a disaster, Governor. I don't know why we're even trying to clean it up.
Taris is a mess.
You've seen this world at its worst. But you've also helped pave the way for the brightest future we could've imagined.
I'm certain there will be many more challenges to overcome as we continue our work.
But I'm also certain your heroic example will inspire everyone who works to make Taris the brightest point in the Republic.
I'm proud to have been a part of something so important.
Thank you very much.
We're all proud to have had you with us.
I won't mind if you name something after me--maybe with a big, impressive plaque.
Feel free to build a memorial.
We'll be sure to keep that in mind.
I appreciate all the praise, but I have places to be.
Can I go now?
Of course. We wouldn't want to hold you up anymore.
Travel safely.
We still have obstacles to face before we can begin our work in earnest--obstacles that you could help us overcome.
When you feel up to doing more to help the Republic here, speak to Bardo--he'll arrange a meeting at my office. Until then, take care.
Been a real pleasure. Thanks again for everything.
Watch your back out there.
Fantastic, you're back! Governor Saresh needs to speak to you right away--hold on.
How wonderful to see you again! I'm sure you're already noticing the changes your efforts have brought.
Rakghoul attacks are down eighty percent in the resettlement zone, and the few we encounter are repelled more easily.
Construction crews are back to work--with a bit of arm twisting--and they're developing more ambitious projects. They believe in what we're doing again--thanks to you.
We just helped everyone find the courage they had all along.
It was nothing.
It will be a pleasure to see what you and your workers can create together.
The future is bright.
It's always good to see people fired up about the Republic's work.
Glad to help morale.
Fighting monsters, inspiring the people to greatness... all in a day's work.
That's just how I work.
Unfortunately, not all of the news is good. Our success has come at a price.
Now that progress is being made, will the Republic send more resources?
Will this bring more support?
I'm doing my best to see that they do. But in spite of our success, we still have some serious challenges.
If that's all, Governor, I should get going.
I have places to be.
I wish the challenges were over, but our success has come at a price.
The rakghouls we've displaced now threaten our forward expedition teams. We've endangered our most vulnerable projects.
The work those teams are doing is critical to reclaiming Taris. If we don't help them, the confidence we've worked so hard to restore could die forever.
Excuse me! Sorry to interrupt, but the governor needs to speak with you right away.
Ah--it's good to finally speak with you. I'm Governor Saresh, the overseer of the Taris reconstruction project.
Rakghoul attacks in the wilderness have reached epidemic proportions. Our expedition teams are in danger of being completely wiped out.
The scientists and workers on those teams are critical to our plans to expand across Taris. If they can't finish their work, our entire project will fall apart.
We won't stand by while innocent lives are at risk.
Then I'll help.
We've come much too far to let things fall apart now.
You can count on me.
If you need volunteers to help Taris, look no further.
That won't happen.
Your people will get the job done--you've got my word.
Leave it to me.
I knew I could count on you.
Aren't there security forces to protect these people?
How did it get so bad?
Of course. And their numbers are dwindling rapidly.
I don't have time to get dragged into another problem on Taris.
Don't look at me.
This is no small problem--the future of the entire reconstruction project depends on this.
Everyone working in that wilderness has lost friends and comrades--they're frightened, and losing hope quickly.
I need you to rekindle that hope--to show our people that no enemy is too powerful to overcome.
Let's get to work--it sounds like there's a lot to do.
I'll see to it immediately.
Once we've finished, they won't even remember why they were so worried.
Simple as could be.
I'd like nothing better.
The team leads are at Brejik's Run--it was a top-notch swoop track before the Sith attacked.
A speeder will take you out once you're ready. When you land, find my agent, Vealo--he'll be your guide.
Hundreds of lives and millions of credits were sacrificed to bring us to this point. Do whatever it takes--our project cannot fail.
I've done enough, Governor. No more.
Forget it. [Refuse quest]
I'm disappointed that you feel that way. I hope you reconsider.
Blast it....
Nice work.
Good luck out there.
The governor is waiting for you.
Good day to you.
